Bet_Text:
BACK (WIN) #5 Go Go Evie for 1.5 units (Rated at: $3.90)

Go Go Evie has been competing in some higher quality races in her last two starts at this venue and she may find this easier. This is her third tricky box so far this campaign but should at least mean the price holds up. This is a must lead situation and if she’s does lead I think they will struggle to catch her.

LAY (WIN) #1 Selynya Blue for 1 unit (Rated at: $8.00)

Selynya Blue is a wide runner who covers a lot of extra ground in races so he isn’t suited by the inside draw. He will look to try and hook around these rivals and by the time he gets to the outside it’s likely going to be too late.

BACK (WIN) #4 Page One News for 1 unit (Rated at: $2.60)

Page One News looked like she needed the day at the races after beginning in the back half of the field at her debut room. With all these runners being known, I’m willing to give her another chance in what looks a weak Maiden overall and hope she begins more speedily.

LAY (WIN) #6 Magnet Mover for 1.5 units (Rated at: $5.00)

Magnet Mover has plenty of placings and in better races so he should be well backed again here. Punters patience with this dog would be wearing very thin and I believe he may just be chasing the leader and there’s not much will to win there and that’s enough for a Lay bet.

LAY (WIN) #3 All Talent for 1 unit (Rated at: $3.30)

Purely at the likely Price point, I’m Laying All Talent. He has been costly at his last few starts and has been mixing his venues and distance ranges.if Yankee Girl can drive up under him I can see him finding bother in the early stages.

BACK (WIN) #8 Vinegar Chips for 1.5 units (Rated at: $6.50)

I like backing Vinegar Chips from wide draws and gets that here with the Pink. He looks great value in early markets so hopefully that can hold up late. He should be able to get that space required early in this race and will keep grinding away.

BACK: 9. Better Blue Boys (WIN) for 1.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $1.80)

He didn't handle the pressure when expected to win last time out at short odds & broke early taking no part in the race. Dropping in grade today, this looks ideal.

BACK: 2. Tooram Magic (WIN) for 3 unit(s) (Rated at: $1.30)

Shows a lot of promise at the trials and expected to be winning here.

BACK: 10. Better Kiss Me (WIN) for 3 unit(s) (Rated at: $1.80)

This horse has always had talent but took a while to learn the craft on the track. Last prep he really improved & now faces a winnable race fresh off a solid trial win.

BACK: 7. Bettor Have Faith (WIN) for 3 unit(s) (Rated at: $1.40)

Bettor Have Faith put up an extraordinary performance first up, better manners will see her win easily here.

BACK: 5. Yankie Kev (WIN) for 2 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.20)

Yankie Kev was a nice winner two starts back and was probably even better last time when did the work and went down narrowly.  He is the one to beat.

BACK: 3. Storm The Beach  (WIN) for 3 unit(s) (Rated at: $1.85)

Storm The Beach was enormous here last time and a repeat of that would see him mighty hard to beat.  Expect him to be driven aggressively.

BACK: 1. Minor Catastrophe (WIN) for 1 unit(s) (Rated at: $6.00)

Minor Catastrophe is low flying at the moment and she loves the stand.  She can be very dangerous from leaders back or 3 pegs.

BACK: 2. Xpresso (WIN) for 1.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $2)

Brings some excellent Sydney form to this race and with James Orman going on I expect he is very hard to beat in a race at this level.

LAY: 7. Quest Of Quests (WIN) for 0.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $9)

Bar plates go on for the first time and after an average performance at Beaudesert last time I am happy to risk at single figures.

BACK: 5. Toro Strike (WIN) for 1 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.4)

Jim Byrne sticks after the most recent trial and the stable has been waiting patiently to find the right race to make the debut. The stable is striking at 30% their last 50 runners.

SAVE: 4. Wolf Prince for 1 unit 

WOLF PRINCE is a tough horse that races very well at Oakbank. Ran a bold race in much tougher company than this last start behind the flying CRIMSON VINE. Track/distance form is great and goes well with Jason Holder aboard.

BACK: 6. Solar Mist (WIN) for 3 units 

SOLAR MIST is a big class dropper here returning from a closing 4th at BM72 metro grade. Will find this grade much easier and draws for a suck run with Jacob Opperman in the saddle. Fitter for 2 runs back from a spell and should be ready to win over this further distance.

BACK: 8. Think Tank (WIN) for 2.5 units 

THINK TANK is working towards a win after some nice efforts lately. Got a fair way back at Murray Bridge but really got through the line well for 3rd. Is proven over this trip and is lightly raced. Might have more upside than the rest.

BACK: 7. Peacemaker (WIN) for 1 unit 

PEACEMAKER got a well deserved with 2 back after a string of luckless runs. Didn’t do much last start up in class but will enjoy getting back to this grade. Smart claim with the 2kg for Felicity Atkinson. He’s got good ability when right. Looks a good each-way chance.

BACK: 7. Peacemaker (PLACE) for 1 unit 

PEACEMAKER got a well deserved with 2 back after a string of luckless runs. Didn’t do much last start up in class but will enjoy getting back to this grade. Smart claim with the 2kg for Felicity Atkinson. He’s got good ability when right. Looks a good each-way chance.

BACK: 3. Thebigsosso (WIN) for 2 units 

THEBIGSOSSO has shown a bit early in his career. Ran 2nd at Bordertown fresh then a close up 4th to STORYTELLER in town. That horse has form around G1 horses. Trained on the track, draws well and 3kg claim for Caitlin Tootell. Hard to beat.

BACK: 1. A Book Of Days (WIN) for 2 unit(s) 

Showed speed and fight on debut at Pakenham over 1200m. First pair again and can only be improved with fitness and experience.

LAY (WIN) #5 Fragile Love for 1 unit (Up to $4.00)

Fair through the line when getting a perfect run throughout last start, strips fitter now but feel the 1200m is not an ideal set up for the filly and will be vulnerable late, tricky map from the wide draw and will need luck early.

BACK (WIN) #1 A Book Of Days for 2 units (Rated at $2.80)

Very keen on the Hayes trained gelding coming off a strong debut over 1200m last start, will roll to the front from the good draw and prove very tough to run down.

BACK (WIN) #6 Upwoods for 2 units (Rated at $2.50)

Consistent galloper now at peak fitness this preparation staying at the suitable 2400m, the in form Damiean Lane will have the gelding juts off the leading group and saved for one sprint at them late.

BACK (WIN) #6 Angel Of Light for 2 units (Rated at $2.70)

Hawkes trained galloper that looks perfectly placed here out to the 3000m after hitting the line well over the shorter trips at her past two starts, will enjoy the run of the race stalking the leading pair throughout from the good draw.

BACK (WIN) #6 Lightning Flash for 1 unit (Rated at $4.00)

Coming off a dominant win last start when leading throughout over 1400m, at peak fitness now and from barrier 1 with Ben Melham on board will find the front and dictate the tempo to suit.

LAY (WIN) #5 For Victory for 1 unit (Rated at: $6.50)

He has gone back in his last few runs which is expected to be a negative today. From a wider barrier, if he does find himself a bit back in the run he may have work to do late to get over the top.

LAY (WIN) #8 Unflinching for 1.5 units (Rated at: $7.00)

UNFLINCHING has shown he can be slick around tight tracks with a good record at Moonee Valley, but he tackles NSW racing for the first time today. Marked as the current fave, while he may be forwards and prominent, I am willing to risk him given this is his first look at this track and feel we are getting value for other runners who will land in a prominent position with him in the run.

BACK (WIN) #1 Union Gap for 1 unit (Rated at: $3.90)

Resumes here today on a track that he has had a super record at previously. Is 2/2 at this track, maps to push forwards and be prominent in the run and looks the one to catch. Can win fresh.

BACK (WIN) #7 CYCLONE TONY for 2 units (Rated at: $2.80)

Cyclone Tony is a Graham Dwyer trained 3YO taking on the usual NR40 suspects. Feel he has his rivals covered for ability, however he has to overcome barrier 7 and tackling 2100m for the first time.

BACK (WIN) #1 ROBYN X for 2 units (Rated at: $1.8)

Robyn X should be leading and proving difficult to run down.

LAY (WIN) #4 JUSTROLLINGAROUND for 1 unit (Rated at: $2.50)

Justrollingaround draws a gate where they will most likely be tempted to go forward. Expect Anyonewilldo can do enough to hold up, thereby ruining her chances of a soft trip.

BACK (PLACE) #2 THE REAPER for 1 unit (Rated at: $2.40)

The Reaper has found form in recent starts, he looks a solid place hope off the 10m mark.

BACK (WIN) #3 MY ROCKY ROMANCE for 2 units (Rated at: $3.00)

My Rocky Romance is a NZ acquisition for Chantal Turpin, the 4YO has only had one career start - a victory at Winton. Trialing 2 weeks ago, he was shuffled back in the run but sizzled home the last 200m. Does he have the speed to head off Onlysbest?

BACK (WIN) #6 Thats Not My Gait for 3 units (Rated at: $1.65)

Thats Not My Gait only has to step here and she will be too good I think.

LAY (WIN) #4 Del Bocavista Bay for 2 units (Rated at: $8.00)

Del Bocavista Bay has his share of ability but can do a bit wrong and looks to have to do some work in the run here so happy to oppose.

BACK (WIN) #1 Nancy Kay for 1 unit (Rated at: $3.30)

Looks the kind of race that Nancy Kay can hold up from the inside and prove hard to run over.

BACK (WIN) #7 Cachinnation for 1 unit (Rated at: $3.30)

Cachinnation has blazing gate speed when he gets it right and if he crosses he will be hard to run over.

BACK (WIN) #5 Sweet Vivienne for 2 units (Rated at: $2.20)

Sweet Vivienne gets the opportunity to push forward here and might even be able to work to the top.  This is a winnable race for her.

BACK (WIN) #3 Classnsmart for 2 units (Rated at: $2.50)

Classnsmart has been racing quite well on the country circuit and can push forward here and if able to find the top will be very hard to beat.

BACK (WIN) #8 Cutting Roses for 1 unit (Rated at: $4.00)

Cutting Roses just needs a draw to pinch one of these, she doesn't get it here but she does have Gary Hall Junior to offset that

BACK (WIN) #7 I Cross My Heart for 1  unit (Rated at: $3.00)

I Cross My Heart is the class runner here, cops the worst draw but can still be very competitive if the speed is on.

BACK (WIN) #1 Little Louie for 3 units (Rated at: $2.20)

This being the heat of the Mildura Cup I believe Little Louie gets a chance to make a statement tonight from the good draw. His best chance of winning the heat and final is by leading all the way around this track and i am confident driver Aaron Brown will be aggressive like last start off the gate and aim for an all the way victory.

LAY (WIN) #4 Always The Showman for 3 units (Rated at: $5.00)

Won a limited race in very slow sectionals four runs back and its form since only fair. Will not be leading tonight and up against an even field. Would have to improve significantly on recent runs to win and I anticipate it will be in the market so just have to be against.

BACK (WIN) #7 Social Writer for 2 units (Rated at: $4.00)

This guy has not had the breaks his last few runs and think tonight is a suitable class race and with an ounce of luck will be right in this. Six of his seven career wins at this distance and Michelle Phillips is an outstanding driver at this track and knows this horse so well. Worth a play here.

BACK: 3. Alors Tu Crois (WIN) for 2 unit(s) 

Plain effort fresh. Improvement expected second-up after a recent jumpout and getting onto a rain-affected track suits, if she can land closer to the speed a winning chance.

LAY: 6. Universal Harmony (WIN) for 2 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.6)

Universal Harmony has a likeable racing pattern and is a consistent as they come, not missing a place in four career starts but he did have every possible chance as an even money favourite last time out at Ballarat.

He looks limited and there are a couple here albeit with lower floors but higher ceilings that I can price Universal Harmony around 2.5.

BACK: 3. Alors Tu Crois (WIN) for 1 unit(s) (Rated at: $4.7)

Alors Tu Crois is advantaged on the heavy track, she produced an underwhelming first-up run at Terang but I really liked the jumpout since.

LAY: 3. Saveadateforme (WIN) for 0.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $9)

Having not won since 30th October 2022, he may get conditions to suit as he has won on a heavy track previously, but it would be an impressive training performance to win after a short break against some race fit horses.

BACK: 4. Zipping Moffat (WIN) for 1.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.4)

Really like the way Zipping Moffat has improved. He was excellent when leading all the way in 30.26 two stars back beating up and comer Lamia Alessia. Even though Boracay Summer has gone quicker that was in a very weak race and Zipping Moffat has more upside.

LAY: 2. Big Smoke Fox (WIN) for 1.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $5)

Big Smoke Fox has won 2 from 33 but will go close to starting favourite here so I’m prepared to take him on. The fact he has run over these distances before will mean he is over bet and the times he runs are only steady. He has only raced once at The Meadows. There are enough reasons to take him on.

LAY: 1. Kimiko (WIN) for 1 unit(s) (Rated at: $5)

There is enough depth to this event to take on Kimiko. Big Yeti is well drawn close to the rails and could be vying for a similar run with Kimiko in the early and middle stages. Lakeview Vincent has been racing well and Box 8 suits. Kimiko hasn’t won a race since June last year.

BACK: 7. Lamia Alessia (WIN) for 2.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $2)

Lamia Alessia should get a ton of room to move here. She looks to have plenty of ability. Her debut win was awesome as she had a few things go wrong and still won. Then the next start she just got beaten by a quicker dog. The small field suits and she should go straight to the lead and win this.

BACK: 4. Gridlocked (WIN) for 1.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $3)

Gridlocked looks to be outgraded here but he does have the most upside. He will be better with a second race start at this venue and is with the powerful Wisener camp. Bun Tornado from Box 1 should keep Gridlocked’s price on the Exchange juicy enough for a bet.

BACK: 8. Peaky Joe (WIN) for 1 unit(s) (Rated at: $3.5)

Peaky Joe is a very handy dog and he has been competing in races much tougher than this. I am not thrilled with Box 8 but this could be compensated by Top Payer beginning speedily, crossing over to the rails and giving Peaky Joe a lovely cart across.

BACK (WIN) #5 Foregone Conclusion for 1 unit (Rated at: $2.50)

This horse has been trying hard & tonight I think it can find the lead so definitely worth a small play.

LAY (WIN) #9 Midnight Dancer for 1 unit (Rated at: $5.00)

I'm not confident this horse will lose this race but I am confident it will start far shorter than it should for a horse of limited ability. I'll risk it.

BACK (WIN) #7 Te Amo for 3 units (Rated at: $1.50)

Forgiving a fresh run error & now dropping back in grade for his 2nd up run tonight, this just looks an ideal set-up. With a relaxed run in transit, I think he's just too good for these.

BACK: 4. Capital Rock (WIN) for 1 unit(s) 

Capital Rock has speed to be forward in running and may control the small field, if she gets her own way may take running down.

BACK: 8. Liberty State (WIN) for 4 unit(s) (Rated at: $1.25)

Liberty State was a 15.3% firmer in the last 30 minutes of betting on the exchange last start at Kyneton and the market was spot on, he smashed the clock running a very strong overall figure. My favourite part of his race was his acceleration between the 400m-200m, he put the race away running that furlong 4.6L faster than maiden average and it was also the fastest of the meeting.

It may appear a boring, lazy bet at the shorts but he is my biggest overlay of any horse all day.

LAY: 11. Simplicity (WIN) for 3 unit(s) (Rated at: $5.2)

This may not come as a shock that I'm laying Simplicity, as I laid Universal Harmony yesterday at Geelong through the same race, the figures from that race were just fair and this is a deep BM64, happy to take on the blue jacket here.

LAY: 8. I Miss Margie (WIN) for 3 unit(s) (Rated at: $4.2)

Gambling on the inside being the worse ground by this stage of the meeting, I Miss Margie has a likeable racing pattern, she will lead and I suggest putting some in-play lays in around the 2.5 price range. She is a limited horse and as mentioned, if they are getting out to the middle of the track, I think she is well and truly under the odds.

BACK (WIN) #12 Miss Joelene for 2 units (Rated at: $2.00)

Stable clearly have an opinion of this horse racing her at group level throughout her short career, she looks extremely well placed first up at this distance in a set weight class 2 race.

BACK (WIN) #1 Transatlantic for 4 units (Rated at: $1.50)

Produced an impressive figure last start and looked to have much more to give. Goes up in weight but I am doubtful it stops this horse that the stable has a good opinion of. He has drawn perfectly to get every opportunity to be sprinting the best in the straight.

LAY (WIN) #9 Tellez for 0.5 units (Rated at: $5.00)

Ran okay behind a smart one last start and although this is an easier race I am respecting Orman electing to ride the fave Lubrication rather than sticking with Tellez for this race.

BACK (WIN) #7 Lady Le Da for 1 unit (Rated at: $3.80)

Has been racing in better races than this and has been running well without winning, if they can run on she will be the one finishing fastest in the straight.

BACK (WIN) #10 Kanazawa for 0.5 units (Rated at: $4.60)

Has raced extremely well since coming to QLD and I expect this horse to continue his consistent form coming into this race. He is 32 days into this race but he won last start of a similar gap between runs and gets a smart claim from a jockey who knows the horse well.

BACK (WIN) #2 Pole Position for 0.5 units (Rated at: $5.00)

Has solid second up form and drawn well in this, he has been competitive in some strong benchmark races in Sydney and I cannot see him running poorly in a race at this level.

BACK (WIN) #3 Volcanic Express for 2 units 

Like the jockey change with VOLCANIC EXPRESS as it was just not getting along well for Sophie Logan. The horse should arguably be 2/2 but has two fourths to the name. Heavily backed last star and the hoop just wouldn't take clear runs. Tragedy beaten. Forgive that and the booking of Kayla Crowther should do the trick. LORD VALEN has put together some really good performances last prep before a spell. Hes ran twice at Murray Bridge for two close 3rd. Jason Holder goes on fresh which suggests the horse isn't out there making up the numbers. SOIUX WARRIOR looked all over a winner but was just nabbed late at Balaklava behind STOKOMO. That horse has since run really well in strong Benchmark races in town. Thats a good form reference for a race like this. OUR GLAMOUR GIRL caught the eye from well back at a huge price on debut FOR 1.6L 5th at $101. Will be fitter for that, nice claim and draws to settle much closer here.

BACK (WIN) JILLADORA for 2 units 

JILLADORA the standout here and looks probably the best of the day. Drops back from competing well without any luck in strong metro races to a BM56 with a pretty long tai. She draws for an easy run and should appreciate getting to a big track. She's clearly the horse to beat. FLY THE LINE is a better horse than recent racing suggests. First up run was excellent before having genuine excuses last time out. If she can bring her best she looks the testing material. SEAFARING is one win from 47 starts but has been running really well the past 18 months. Hard to see him winning but his best form does come at Murray Bridge with 9 placings from 15 attempts. FOX GEM is another resuming and ran some really good races last prep. First up form is OK but does draw for an easy run.

LAY (WIN) #5 Who's Afraid for 1 unit

Finally broke the MDN status last start but arguably still should be as VOLCANIC EXPRESS was the biggest thing beaten you will see. Now steps up to a hot Class One race and has to lump 2.5kg more

BACK (WIN) #14 Gotta Go Guru for 2 units 

GOTTA GO GURU is racing well without luck. Was a drifter in the market first up and had zero luck in the straight. Still got home well for 3rd. Draws for a good run and Holder sticks. AFRICARN LAD was heavily backed last start but didn’t really fire a shot. The start prior was much better. The step up to 1600m suits and is probably better suited at a bigger track like Murray Bridge. WANNASCHMAK has come back in good order this prep and actually finished in-front of GOTTA GO GURU last start. Has form over this track and distance and should be in the finish. DETERON ran a bold race at odds for a close 2nd when leading most of the way. Should take some catching here.

BACK (WIN) #1 Foxy Femme for 2 units 

This is a pretty handy race for a mid-weeker but you would think if FOXY FEMME is anywhere near her best she would be beating these. She's a lightly raced 5 year old mare that has placed 6 times from 8 all at metro level behind smart horses. She's trialed well leading into this and first up form is very strong. Might have too much upside vs these. HOOKED ON WEALTH is an honest campaigner who closed nicely for 3rd fresh. Draws well here and gets some weight relief with the 1.5kg claim for Rochelle Milnes. Has a good overall record at Murray Bridge. HOLLONDAISE is another dropping back from City level. Is fresh here and has some reasonable form around pretty handy horses. Won 2nd up last prep so might need the run here but still expect a forward showing. EGYPTIAN TYCOON is an interesting runner. First up for Phillip Stokes here. Trailed well and gets Lachlan Neindorf on which is creating a brilliant partnership with the Stokes team.

BACK (WIN) DÍSLES for 1 unit win 2 units place. 

DÍSLES was a good run without luck last start. Settled back and took of with a wide searching run up the Strathalbyn hill and peaked late for 4th. The jockey just got itchy feet and took of way too soon. Forgive that effort and the horse should enjoy the rise from 1600m to 1800m. Draws well. APPLIED ran very well here for 2nd two back before not really firing a shot in a BM72 at Oakbank. This looks a better target and meets PERSIAN EMPIRE 1.5kg better at the weights. MR RODMAN was heavily backed into favouritism and had sickening luck at Strathalbyn when was checked badly and caused carnage on the bend and lost all hope. Is a big striding horse so really didn't like being cluttered there. Forgive that and can bounce back here. PERSIAN EMPIRE gave a bold front running sight last start and proved too tough to run down. Good effort. Gets in well with the 3kg claim and loves racing over this track and distance.The one they have to mow down.
BACK (WIN) DÍSLES for 1 unit win 2 units place.

BACK: 7. Explicit  (WIN) for 2 unit(s) (Rated at: $1.8)

Popcorn race of the night to see what Succeed does when trying to chase down one of the best dogs in the country in Explicit. Zelda Chaos should begin speedily and hunt for the rails so Explicit should get a cart across. Annoyingly this could also give Succeed a great run across but I still believe Explicit will shake Succeed off and win this.

LAY: 4. Pete’s Entity  (WIN) for 1.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $4.8)

Yes, Pete’s Entity flew around Geelong last start in 22.37. But this is his first start on a city track and his first start at anything over 450m and has a middle box to deal with. He is bred to get this journey on his ear but I want to see him do it first and until then I’m Laying. Hopefully Shayna Bale can charge across to the lead.

LAY: 5. Flying Dinar  (WIN) for 1.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $5.5)

Happy to Lay Flying Dinar here as I still think she is very iffy and could be content running with the pace here. There is some pace drawn around her with Oprah Bale, Takumi Bale and Daintree Granite hopefully providing a nuisance factor to Flying Dinar in the early stages.

LAY: 6. Kingsley Bale  (WIN) for 1 unit(s) (Rated at: $4)

I find it very hard to Back dogs in any race Settlement Day is involved. He is always a nuisance to whoever I’m Backing so I’m going to roll with the punches here and hope this time he annoys Kingsley Bale when trying to cross in the early stages and perhaps Settlement Day can do me a favour for a change and help with the successful Lay of Kingsley Bale.

LAY: 2. Orli Bale  (WIN) for 1.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.6)

The Grenfell camp are again trying with Orli Bale over this distance range but I’m not convinced he can run it out yet. There are enough opponents here that present wildcard factors in winning this race and this could be a case of the smaller field being against Orli Bale because it may give one of these stronger types a chance to lob right behind him by the winning post the first time around. He is going to be short enough to Lay without much liability.

BACK: 1. Minister Mentor  (WIN) for 2.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.2)

Minister Mentor returned to his best last start at Ballarat running a very handy 30.99 and looks to be getting close to his best after a few runs in after a long break. The inside draw and the wide running Wild Cash in Box 2 looks a great recipe for a strong win bet.

BACK: 4. Lady Vici (WIN) for 2 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.4)

Is now placed out of the draw so will start from barrier 7 due to an error last start. I am not overly concerned about that as will be given time early then is adaptable depending to the tempo of the race from there. Continues to rise in class but is meeting the challenges to date and is all quality.

LAY: 2. Leavemeout (WIN) for 2.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $7.5)

No doubt it has the early speed and can find the lead, however, this is a race of good depth and just find too many more in form horses ahead of it so have to take it on.

BACK: 3. Repelling (WIN) for 3 unit(s) (Rated at: $1.6)

Has been disappointing a few times in the past but his recent runs have just been outstanding. Had excellent gate speed so i expect David Moran to be aggressive early and find the top, just has to repeat his recent runs to be winning if i map the race correctly.

BACK: 3. Sly Terror (WIN) for 2 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.8)

This guy has just had no luck at all in his recent starts. Has been hitting the line hard and running slick sectionals from back in the field. Gets the best draw he has had for ages and if finds the lead like i think he can, will be awfully hard to run down.

LAY: 3. Reigning Captain (WIN) for 1 unit(s) (Rated at: $2.80)

Having a small play against race fave REIGNING CAPTAIN at anything below even money. Purely based on his price vs expected race map. On debut jumping from barrier 8 with speed out in front, depending on where he lands he may find himself under pressure early in the race. He doesn't have to be a star to win this race, but no value at all.

BACK (WIN) #4 Hearcomesthestar for 3 units 

Too far back in a fast-run race first-up, impressive jumpout between runs and gets her preferred soft ground with Mark Zahra legging up.

BACK (WIN) #11 Stylish (WIN) for 2 units (Rated at: $2.60)

Stylish ran well against the pattern of the night first-up here at Pakenham over 1200m in what is shaping up to be a really nice form race. My only issue is her barrier manners but she gets the man for the job, B.Shinn on board.

BACK (WIN) #10 Grid Girl for 4 units (Rated at: $1.80)

Grid Girl won with plenty in hand first-up, then I thought her effort last start to sit on a very fast tempo and make her run in the inferior ground, to stick on to run third was terrific, she's favourite to get more favours here in a weaker race and should be going close.

LAY (WIN) #2 Scorsese for 2 units (Rated at: $7.80)

A really strong Class 1, where I'm happy to take on Scorsese, he fell in two back in a weak Colac maiden before going up in grade and running a basic race at Sandown.

LAY: 5. Greenidge (WIN) for 0.5 unit(s) (Rated at: $7)

Has only produced average overall figures to date and has been much bigger starting prices than what she will be in this race. She will need to improve drastically to beat Angland who looks to have above average ability.

BACK (WIN) #6 Golden Lady for 1 unit (Rated at: $8.00)

Golden Lady can be hit or miss early but if she pings the lids here I doubt they catch her. This is a must lead situation out of the boxes if we are to get a collect.

BACK (WIN) #6 Lady Julia for 1.5 units (Rated at: $2.65)

This looks to be a battle between Lady Julia and Lenaghan. Lady Julia has the more reliable early speed and even from Box 6 I think she can cross over to the lead and pinch a mid race break and hold on to win. Lenaghan can be unreliable early and will be looking to hook to the outside to find space.

LAY (WIN) #7 Bushman’s Damper (WIN) for 1 unit (Rated at: $4.00)
